newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia's GPG H1 pre-tax swings into black.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia's GPG H1 pre-tax swings into black.

text.p: Slovenian construction company Gradbeno Podjetje Grosuplje d.d. (GPG) said on Thursday pre-tax profit in the first half jumped to 7.3 million tolars ($55,300) from a loss of 54 million in the first half of 1995.
GPG forecasts a full year pre-tax profit of 123.7 million tolars.

"We expect to realise this plan because our sector is very seasonal and the majority of profits is expected in the second half of the year," general manager Bogdan Korosec told a news conference in Ljubljana.
Sales in the first six months slumped to 2.8 billion tolars ($21.2 million), from 3.4 billion in the year-ago period.
"The fall in sales was due to delays in some projects connected to privatisation problems," Korosec said.
But GPG expects 1996 sales of eight billion tolars, up from 5.9 billion tolars last year.
GPG is Slovenia's third-largest construction firm with a market share of 4.1 percent. -- Novica Mihajlovic, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
